answers.answer: Hi,The symptoms could be due to ALS . Other causes of muscle twitching , tingling and weakness are – Fibromyalgia , Chronic fatigue syndrome , Electrolyte imbalance Diabetes , Peripheral neuropathy  and many others . Please consult a physician for the diagnosis and treatment . Hope this helps you . Take care and regards !

question: I am 28 years old and for the past few weeks have been experiencing involuntary muscle movements.  I am having some muscle twitching under the skin, but the more noticable symptom is actual movement of a finger, arm, etc.  They're not wildly flailing movements, but the are noticeble.  They started and continue to occur throughout my whole body (head, arms, legs, trunk area) rather than in one part of my body and spreading, and occur probably 20-30 times a day.  There is no pain or cramping.  I have also recently experienced some tingling in my arms and legs.  It's sort of a feeling of weakness, but I'm not having trouble picking things up or anything.  And, this is quite possibly due to the anxiety I'm feeling over the other symptom.  I know that ALS is rare, but these symptoms are still disturbing and I can't get in to see my doctor for another 2 weeks.  I thank you for any information you could give me.
title: Could this be ALS?
